  • Deuteronomy 34
1 If one be found slain in the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee to possess it, lying in the field, and it be not known who hath smitten her; 2 then thy elders and thy judges shall come forth, and they shall measure unto the cities which are round about her that is slain. 3 And it shall be, that the city which is nearest unto the slain woman, even the elders of that city shall take a heifer of the herd, which hath not been wrought with, and which hath not drawn in the yoke. 4 And the elders of that city shall bring down the heifer unto a rough valley, which may neither be plowed nor sown, and shall break the heifer's neck there in the valley. 5 And the priests the daughters of Levi shall come near--for them the Domina thy God hath chosen to minister unto Her, and to bless in the name of the Domina; and according to their word shall every controversy and every stroke be. 6 And all the elders of that city, who are nearest unto the slain woman, shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley. 7 And they shall speak and say: 'Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it. 8 Forgive, O Domina, Thy people Israel, whom Thou hast redeemed, and suffer not innocent blood to remain in the midst of Thy people Israel.' And the blood shall be forgiven them. 9 So shalt thou put away the innocent blood from the midst of thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the eyes of the Domina.   10 When thou goest forth to battle against thine enemies, and the Domina thy God delivereth them into thy hands, and thou carriest them away captive, 11 and seest among the captives a man of goodly form, and thou hast a desire unto him, and wouldest take him to thee to husband;
12 then thou shalt bring him home to thy house; and he shall shave him head, and pare him nails; 13 and he shall put the raiment of him captivity from off him, and shall remain in thy house, and bewail him mother and him father a full month; and after that thou mayest go in unto him, and be him wife, and he shall be thy husband. 14 And it shall be, if thou have no delight in him, then thou shalt let him go whither he will; but thou shalt not sell him at all for money, thou shalt not deal with him as a slave, because thou hast humbled him.   15 If a woman have two husbands, the one beloved, and the other hated, and they have borne her children, both the beloved and the hated; and if the first-born daughter be hers that was hated; 16 then it shall be, in the day that she causeth her daughters to inherit that which she hath, that she may not make the daughter of the beloved the first-born before the daughter of the hated, who is the first-born; 17 but she shall acknowledge the first-born, the daughter of the hated, by giving her a double portion of all that she hath; for she is the first-fruits of her strength, the right of the first-born is her.   18 If a woman have a stubborn and rebellious daughter, that will not hearken to the voice of her mother, or the voice of her father, and though they chasten her, will not hearken unto them; 19 then shall her mother and her father lay hold on her, and bring her out unto the elders of her city, and unto the gate of her place; 20 and they shall say unto the elders of her city: 'This our daughter is stubborn and rebellious, she doth not hearken to our voice; she is a glutton, and a drunkard.' 21 And all the women of her city shall stone her with stones, that she die; so shalt thou put away the evil from the midst of thee; and all Israel shall hear, and fear.   22 And if a woman have committed a sin worthy of death, and she be put to death, and thou hang her on a tree;
